text: Moodring is the third studio album by American recording artist Mýa. It was her last studio album for then joint record label A&M; and Interscope Records, released on July 22, 2003. ==Reviews== {{Album ratings | MC = 63/100 | rev1 = Allmusic | rev1Score = | rev2 = BBC Music | rev2Score = favorableBBC Music review | rev3 = Blender | rev3Score = | rev4 = Entertainment Weekly | rev4Score = B− | rev5 = People | rev5Score = unfavorable | rev6 = PopMatters | rev6Score = 4/10 | rev7 = Rolling Stone | rev7Score = | rev8 = USA Today | rev8Score = USA Today review | rev9 = Vibe | rev9Score = | rev10 = The Village Voice | rev10Score = favorable }} Moodring received generally positive reviews from music critics. ==Track listing== ==Charts and certifications== ===Weekly charts=== Chart (2003) Peak position Australian Albums (ARIA)"ARIA Top 100 Albums - Week Commencing 8th September 2003". ARIA Charts. Retrieved 17 February 2009. 74 Canadian Albums (Jam! Canoe) 25 Japanese Albums (Oricon) 53 UK Albums (OCC) 198 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (2003) Rank position US Billboard 200 157 US Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums (Billboard) 86 ===Certifications=== ==Tour== ==Release history== Region Date Label Japan June 26, 2003 Interscope United Kingdom July 21, 2003 United States July 22, 2003 Australia August 28, 2003 Germany September 8, 2003 Austria October 29, 2003 Switzerland ==References== Category:2003 albums Category:Hip hop albums Category:Hip hop soul albums Category:R&B; albums Category:Mýa albums Category:Interscope albums
title: Moodring
